name.text: Calculating the surface area of the cube from its net.

questiontext.text:
The figure below shows a cube. Sketch the net of the cube and work out the surface area of the cube from its net.

[[jsxgraph]] var board = JXG.JSXGraph.initBoard('jxgbox', { boundingbox: [-50, 350, 350, -50], keepAspectRatio: true, axis: false, showCopyright: false }); // ----------- CUBE VERTICES ----------- // Front face var A = board.create('point', [90, 90], {name: 'A', size: 2, color: 'black'}); var B = board.create('point', [202.5, 90], {name: 'B', size: 2, color: 'black'}); var C = board.create('point', [202.5, 202.5], {name: 'C', size: 2, color: 'black'}); var D = board.create('point', [90, 202.5], {name: 'D', size: 2, color: 'black'}); // Back face var E = board.create('point', [135, 45], {name: 'E', size: 2, color: 'black'}); var F = board.create('point', [247.5, 45], {name: 'F', size: 2, color: 'black'}); var G = board.create('point', [247.5, 157.5], {name: 'G', size: 2, color: 'black'}); var H = board.create('point', [135, 157.5], {name: 'H', size: 2, color: 'black'}); // ----------- FACES (wireframe) ----------- board.create('polygon', [A, B, C, D], { borders: {strokeColor: 'blue'}, fillColor: 'none', vertices: {visible: false} }); board.create('polygon', [E, F, G, H], { borders: {strokeColor: 'blue'}, fillColor: 'none', vertices: {visible: false} }); // Connect corresponding corners (edges between front and back faces) board.create('segment', [A, E], {strokeColor: 'blue'}); board.create('segment', [B, F], {strokeColor: 'blue'}); board.create('segment', [C, G], {strokeColor: 'blue'}); board.create('segment', [D, H], {strokeColor: 'blue'}); // ----------- DIMENSION LABELS ----------- board.create('text', [146, 210, '{#side#} cm'], {fontSize: 14, color: 'black'}); board.create('text', [225, 185, '{#side#} cm'], {fontSize: 14, color: 'black'}); board.create('text', [250, 110, '{#side#} cm'], {fontSize: 14, color: 'black'}); [[/jsxgraph]]

Surface area=[[input:ans1]] cm\(^2\) [[validation:ans1]][[feedback:prt1]]

(b).Calculating the surface area.

\(\begin{align}\text{The area of one face}&=length \times width\\&={@side@} cm\times {@side@} cm\\&={@area_of_squareA@} cm^2\end{align}\)

\(\begin{align}\text{There are 6 faces. Therefore, the surface area of the cube}&=6 \times \text{area of one face}\\&=6 \times {@area_of_squareA@} cm^2\\&={@ta@} cm^2\end{align}\)

Alternative

\(\begin{align}\text{Area of square A}&=length \times width\\&={@side@} cm\times {@side@} cm\\&={@area_of_squareA@} cm^2\end{align}\)

\(\begin{align}\text{Area of square B}&=length \times width\\&={@side@} cm\times {@side@} cm\\&={@area_of_squareA@} cm^2\end{align}\)

\(\begin{align}\text{Area of square C}&=length \times width\\&={@side@} cm\times {@side@} cm\\&={@area_of_squareA@} cm^2\end{align}\)

\(\begin{align}\text{Area of square D}&=length \times width\\&={@side@} cm\times {@side@} cm\\&={@area_of_squareA@} cm^2\end{align}\)

\(\begin{align}\text{Area of square E}&=length \times width\\&={@side@} cm\times {@side@} cm\\&={@area_of_squareA@} cm^2\end{align}\)

\(\begin{align}\text{Area of square F}&=length \times width\\&={@side@} cm\times {@side@} cm\\&={@area_of_squareA@} cm^2\end{align}\)

\(\begin{align}\text{Surface area of the cube}&={@area_of_squareA@} cm^2+{@area_of_squareB@} cm^2+{@area_of_squareC@} cm^2+{@area_of_squareD@} cm^2+{@area_of_squareE@} cm^2+{@area_of_squareF@} cm^2\\&={@ta@} cm^2\end{align}\)

truefeedback.text: It looks like you found the perimeter instead of the area. Remember, perimeter measures the distance around the edge, but surface area is all about the space inside each face. Try squaring the side length instead — you’re close, just a small switch in the formula will get you there
